console.form.ydb.YdbConnectionSettings.i: Host and port of YDB instance.
console.form.ydb.YdbConnectionSettings.t: OAuth token of the user on whose behalf YDB will be accessed. If left empty, access will be performed on behalf of the robot robot-lf-dyn-push.
console.form.ydb.YdbPartitionPolicy.part: Table size in the selected units
console.form.ydb.YdbPartitionPolicy.time: The column by whose values to split the table. The column must be of type time.
console.form.ydb.YdbSource.changefeed_cu: Specify the name of the ChangeFeed here, if you have already created it. Otherwise, leave this field empty
console.form.ydb.YdbSource.paths.title: Included paths list
console.form.ydb.YdbSource.paths.usage: You can specify tables and directories. For Snapshot transfers, you may skip specifying paths. In this case, all tables will be transferred. For other types of transfers, specifying paths is required.
console.form.ydb.YdbSource.title: Endpoint parameters
console.form.ydb.YdbTarget.cleanup_polic: Cleanup policy for activate, reactivate and reupload processes. Default value is DROP.
console.form.ydb.YdbTarget.replace_uploa: YQL for writing. Works using "REPLACE INTO". Significantly slows down insertion and loads data on shards.
console.form.ydb.YdbTarget.title: Endpoint parameters
console.form.ydb.YdbTargetAdvancedSettin: Renaming tables created by the transfer.
Set up COMPRESSION setting for column group (FAMILY default) (read more https://docs.yandex-team.ru/ydb-tech/yql/reference/syntax/create_table#column-family)
Should create column-oriented table (OLAP). By default create row-oriented (OLTP)
Resulting table path - {Path in YDB}/{Directory in DB}/{Table}
If populated, will add a "_shard_col" column to each row. The shard will be calculated as the remainder of the current time hash divided by the number of shards.
